column4: Hi guys I can't manage to get my nvidia drivers working in hardy heron, everything installs just fine without errors but when I reboot I get a prompt to run in low graphics mode saying there's no drivers installed
I did that millions of times reinstalling
I even used the nvidia.com driver
and tried installing the packages from synaptic
yet still when I try to restart after a perfect install of drivers it says low gfx mode
what could be the cause of this?
Could it be a problem that I'm still running hardy beta?
It is a bit confusing when you type over multiple lines, please keep your messages to one send. Could you put your xorg.conf on pastebin.org please ?
the xorg.conf file is at http://pastebin.org/31806
You said you tried the Nvidia binary from nvidia.com ?
are you finding anything in my xorg.conf?
It seems that you are using the open source nv drivers on a board called "vesa". Try letting the nvidia driver reconfigure it
by reconfiguring it, do you mean installing the nvidia drivers? Because that's what I did lots of times but it just ends up back in low-res mode back to vesa.
Have you tried sudo dpkg reconfigure xserver-xorg
will try dpkg now, but when I select nvidia as the driver name it doesn't work.
I can't suggest anything else, sorry.
